The thyroid cartilage , which forms the Adam's apple, is the largest and 
uppermost of nine cartilages within the larynx, or voice box. (Cartilage is a strong 
but flexible tissue.) It houses the vocal folds, also known as the vocal cords. ... 
front of the neck, is generally more prominent in men because of a sharper angle 
in males.

question: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows an anatomical diagram on the monitor.)  The Adam's apple, which is larger in men than in women, is a protuberance of the thyroid cartilage that supports this passageway, sometimes called the voice box
